title: Addresses and letters of travel,
author: Nye, Stephen Girard
snippet: He had drunken sprees lasting sometimes weeks, sometimes months, followed by remorse and sobriety, until the omnipresent saloon awoke again his slumbering appetite. I remember him as a medical witness in a murder case in the District Court in this town. He came upon the heels of a spree, with bloated face, bloodshot eyes, and unstrung nerves and dared not trust his voice or memory until he had swallowed several inordinate-sized drinks.
